abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Housing Finance
            Markets Strengthening Project for Mexico were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: the dual
            objectives of financial stabilization and market development
            requires favorable market conditions and tight and direct
            linkages between what is being financed and what is the
            desired outcome to be effective. The project might have
            benefited from a more modest objective of just
            stabilization, in particular given the market turbulence.
            Market stabilization can generate important development
            benefits by preventing negative impacts, particularly during
            a time of crisis, which commonly hit the lowest-income
            sectors the hardest. The link between the expenditures
            financed and the outcomes must be straightforward. Project
            design should maximize the ability of the project to
            leverage change. Finally, the instrument used-an investment
            loan with a fast disbursement component-enabled the Bank to
            address the specific needs of the Borrower but at the same
            time contributed to the main shortcomings of the project design.
